verbs.description: telepathize (third-person singular simple present telepathizes, present participle telepathizing, simple past and past participle telepathized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, parapsychology) To establish contact with or to receive via telepathy.
examples: Suppose we assume that the percipient does precognitively telepathize the two-seconds-in-the-future psychological state of the agent's brain/mind.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, parapsychology) To engage in telepathic communication.
examples: It does not seem to make sense to speak of learning to telepathize.
